overall_building_description: The Long 'D' Ring - Dolly assembly is a specialized lifting device designed for industrial applications, utilizing high-strength AISI 4142 steel plate with a minimum yield strength of 100 ksi. The device's structural integrity is ensured through the use of 2-inch thick plates, conforming to the latest edition of S16-09 standards for structural steel. The dolly's top view reveals a precise dimension of 24 1/2 inches in length and 2 inches in width, scaled at 1:8 for detailed representation. The front view further delineates critical angular dimensions of 49.5° and 40.5°, essential for maintaining the structural balance during lifting operations. The device's maximum lifting capacity is specified at 17 tons per link, with a 3-inch diameter shackle pin, necessitating precise alignment to ensure vertical lifts only. Compliance with safety regulations under the OHSA is mandatory, with explicit instructions for clear labeling of lifting capacities and maintaining a permanent record of the drawing. The design incorporates lifting lugs engineered for vertical lifts, emphasizing the need for centering on the shackle pin to prevent lateral instability. The assembly's fabrication requires all structural steel to be new material, with plates painted as specified by the owner, ensuring durability and resistance to environmental factors. Special provisions are made for salvaging plate cut-outs for alternate use, optimizing material utilization. The absence of the lifting beam in the drawings is intentional for clarity, focusing on the dolly's core structural components. The assembly sequence mandates adherence to precise joint configurations and reinforcement layouts, with a focus on maintaining the device's structural integrity under maximum load conditions. The dolly's spatial configuration is meticulously detailed, with section callouts '2/S1' and '3/S1' providing critical insights into the device's load path and connection details. The engineering design prioritizes deflection criteria and shear transfer mechanisms, ensuring the dolly's performance under dynamic loading conditions. The fabrication process involves stringent quality control measures, including welding symbols and bolt specifications, to meet the highest industry standards. The assembly's erection procedures are outlined to ensure safe and efficient installation, with temporary bracing requirements specified to maintain stability during construction. The dolly's design reflects a comprehensive understanding of load path analysis, with a focus on bearing capacity and lateral stability, ensuring its suitability for demanding industrial applications.
